content.rendered:
Great selection of colors and typography in this edition of Friday Likes with work from Nashville, Monterrey, and Toronto.

Woodland Wine Merchant by Perky Bros

Located in Nashville, TN, Woodland Wine Merchant is a “tidy and eclectic” wine, spirits, and beer store. To reflect their discerning choices, local designer Jefferson Perky chose a red fox as a representation of hunting and gathering. The fox is presented in two ways: first, as the logo with the fox strutting nonchalantly in a more natural representation, and, second, as a close up of its face in a more interpretative representation and set as an amazing pattern. The olive green color with the burst of orange and gray typography looks earthy and delicious. The condensed, rounded sans serif is a great complement to the traditional illustration and vintage-looking pattern. Very foxy all around. See full project.

Tamarindo by La Tortilleria

Tamarindo is a restaurant, cafe, bar, and retailer in Ourense, Spain, with a beautifully relaxed identity designed by Monterrey, Mexico-based La Tortilleria. The logo is typeset in what looks like a modified version of Orator that has been very generously letter-spaced, giving the spare layouts a sense of modernity. The identity revolves around splitting every canvas in half, from business cards to coasters to bottles of water to coffee cup sleeves. It’s such a simple idea that, executed with a concise palette of colors and materials, yields a cohesive and endearing set of applications. See full project here.

Ben Weeks by Tung

Disclaimer, I guess: I have worked with Toronto-based illustrator Ben Weeks in the past, he’s come to our conferences, and we chat whenever we run across each other. However, he has failed to hand me one of these sweet, sweet new business cards of his, designed by local firm Tung. Perhaps some purists might disagree with me but this is a really great Wolfgang Weingart allusion, whether intentional or not. It’s spare in its elements but it’s amazingly dynamic and full of energy and tension. The color palette is also quite fun and adds to the New Wave effect. Ben, you’ve got my address, put a set of them in the mail for me? See full project.

excerpt.rendered: Great selection of colors and typography in this edition of Friday Likes with work from Nashville, Monterrey, and Toronto….
